purpleculture_pinyin:

to spread; to display; to set up; (old) holder for door-knocker
распространять; для отображения; установить; (старый) держатель для дверного молотка

plank bed; place to sleep; shop; store; (old) relay station
лежак; место для сна; магазин; хранить; (старая) ретрансляционная станция
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 铺)
Pictophonetic: 甫 indicates the sound; 釒 (money) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
鋪設 [ pū shè ]: to lay (railroad tracks, carpet, pipeline); to install (wiring, cable); to construct (road, concrete slab)
鋪天蓋地 [ pū tiān gài dì ]: lit. hiding the sky and covering the earth (idiom); fig. earth-shattering; omnipresent; of universal importance
鋪蓋 [ pū gai ]: bedding; bedclothes
鋪張浪費 [ pū zhāng làng fèi ]: extravagance and waste (idiom)
鋪軌 [ pū guǐ ]: to lay railway track
鋪子 [ pù zi ]: store; shop
鋪面 [ pù miàn ]: front window; store front

chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: This shop has metal dog tags hanging from the front door handle to tell you what kind of shop it is.
humanum_full_description_en:
" Pu " is a round ritual vessel used to hold millet, shaped like a bean, with a disc on the top and a ring on the bottom. A cover is added in the spring and autumn.

Bronze beginning to see " shop " word, spread the word unearthed bronze in the four shop-shaped, from the earliest " Bamboo " from " just " make " 𥮉 " reflect the existing shop or at the time of bamboo; from gold from the late Western Zhou Fu, The pre-Qin gold is today’s bronze; in the Spring and Autumn Period, "Zeng Zhongzhu’s father’s shop" was only written as " Fu ", and the inscription says: "Zeng Zhongzhu’s father came from Zhabaofu", which should be the province body of 𥮉 and shop; later there was Conglu Congfu, The shape of the dong-like vessel is made of bamboo, gold or 匚 as the symbol of the meaning, and the sound symbol is the pu.

Some scholars believe that in the past " shop ", " 𥮉 " that is, " basket used in state worship " word for beans is a circular vessel, because "Wen said," goes: "basket used in state worship, Shuji won is" paved with the same shape Used, and With "䀇" as the name of the square vessel, this is a quotient. According to the different views of the shape of 簠 characters found in the unearthed bronze 簠, "簠" should be a square food vessel named " 𠤳 ", "簠", "䀇"," 𠤳 ", " 𠤱 ", " Hu " It is the same character in different form, refer to "簠".
humanum_short_description_en: " Pu " is a round ritual vessel used to hold millet, shaped like a bean, with a disc on the top and a ring on the bottom. A cover is added in spring and autumn.
humanum_full_description:
「鋪」是用以盛黍稷的圓形禮器，形制如豆，上為圓盤，下有圈足，春秋時增設器蓋。

　　金文始見「鋪」字，出土青銅鋪中的鋪字有四形，最早從「竹」從「甫」，作「𥮉」，反映當時或已有竹製之鋪；西周晚期從金從甫，先秦的金即今日的青銅；春秋時〈曾仲斿父鋪〉只寫作「甫」，銘文云：「曾仲斿父自乍寶甫」，應為𥮉、鋪之省體；後又有從匚從甫，匚象器皿形，皆從竹、金或匚作為義符，以甫為聲符。

　　過去有學者認為「鋪」、「𥮉」即「簠」字，為豆屬的圓形器皿，因《說文》云：「簠，黍稷圜器」，與鋪的形製器用同，而以「䀇」為方形器皿之名，此說可商。自出土青銅簠中所見的不同簠字字形觀之，「簠」應是出土所見自名為「𠤳」的方形食器，「簠」、「䀇」、「𠤳」、「𠤱」、「胡」為同字異體，參「簠」。
humanum_short_description: 「鋪」是用以盛黍稷的圓形禮器，形制如豆，上為圓盤，下有圈足，春秋時增設器蓋。

Chinese: At an alternative shop [alternate] you can buy strange items like metal dogtags from wars, active grenades, torture sets, etc.
Meaning: shop
Hanzi: 铺
Story: This shop has metal dog tags hanging from the front door handle to tell you what kind of shop it is.
Kind: traditional

「 鋪 」是用以盛黍稷的圓形禮器，形制如豆，上為圓盤，下有圈足，春秋時增設器蓋。 金文始見「 鋪 」字，出土青銅鋪中的鋪字有四形，最早從「 竹 」從「 甫 」，作「 𥮉 」，反映當時或已有竹製之鋪；西周晚期從金從甫，先秦的金即今日的青銅；春秋時〈曾仲斿父鋪〉只寫作「 甫 」，銘文云：「曾仲斿父自乍寶甫」，應為𥮉、鋪之省體；後又有從匚從甫，匚象器皿形，皆從竹、金或匚作為義符，以甫為聲符。 過去有學者認為「 鋪 」、「 𥮉 」即「 簠 」字，為豆屬的圓形器皿，因《說文》云：「簠，黍稷圜器」，與鋪的形製器用同，而以「 䀇 」為方形器皿之名，此說可商。自出土青銅簠中所見的不同簠字字形觀之，「 簠 」應是出土所見自名為「 𠤳 」的方形食器，「 簠 」、「 䀇 」、「 𠤳 」、「 𠤱 」、「 胡 」為同字異體，參「 簠 」。
" Pu" is a round ritual vessel used to hold millet, shaped like a bean, with a disc on the top and a ring on the bottom. A cover is added in the spring and autumn. Bronze beginning to see " shop" word, spread the word unearthed bronze in the four shop-shaped, from the earliest " Bamboo" from " just" make " 𥮉" reflect the existing shop or at the time of bamboo; from gold from the late Western Zhou Fu, The pre-Qin gold is today’s bronze; in the Spring and Autumn Period, "Zeng Zhongzhu’s father’s shop" was only written as " Fu", and the inscription says: "Zeng Zhongzhu’s father came from Zhabaofu", which should be the province body of 𥮉 and shop; later there was Conglu Congfu, The shape of the dong-like vessel is made of bamboo, gold or 匚 as the symbol of the meaning, and the sound symbol is the pu. Some scholars believe that in the past " shop", " 𥮉" that is, " basket used in state worship" word for beans is a circular vessel, because "Wen said," goes: "basket used in state worship, Shuji won is" paved with the same shape Used, and With " 䀇" as the name of the square vessel, this is a quotient. According to the different views of the shape of 簠 characters found in the unearthed bronze 簠, " 簠" should be a square food vessel named " 𠤳", " 簠", " 䀇"," 𠤳", " 𠤱", " Hu" It is the same character in different form, refer to " 簠".

鋪字的基本解释

鋪
pū

鋪
pù
均见“铺”。

鋪字的汉语字典释义

[①]［pū］
［《廣韻》普胡切，平模，滂。］
［《廣韻》芳無切，平虞，敷。］
亦作“舖1”。“铺1”的繁体字。
(1)古铜器之一种。豆属。
(2)陈列；布置。
(3)展开；摊平。
(4)披挂；覆盖。
(5)铺叙。
(6)布；宣扬。
(7)潽，溢出。
(8)量词。多用以表示面积或体积较大的物量。
(9)铺首。著于门上的衔环兽面。
(10)象声词。
(11)通“痡”。病苦。
(12)通“鎛”。锄田去草的农具。
(13)通“餔”。参见“鋪食”。
[②]［pù］
［《廣韻》普故切，去暮，滂。］
亦作“舖2”。“铺2”的繁体字。
(1)卧具；床铺。
(2)商店。
(3)驿站。

鋪字的康熙字典解释

【戌集上】【金字部】　鋪； 康熙笔画：15； 页码：页1308第21
【唐韻】普胡切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】滂模切，?音?。【說文】著門鋪首也。从金甫聲。【增韻】所以銜環者，作龜蛇之形，以銅爲之，故曰金鋪。【前漢·揚雄傳】排玉戸而颺金鋪兮。【註】鋪，門首也。　又【廣韻】?也，布也。【詩·周南序疏】賦之言鋪，直鋪?今之政敎善惡。又【小雅·乃安斯寢箋】乃鋪席，與羣臣安燕以樂之。【大雅】鋪敦淮濆。【註】鋪，布也。布其師旅也。【禮·樂記】鋪筵席，?尊俎。　又病也。與痡通。【詩·周南·我僕痡矣釋文】痡，音敷。又普烏反。本又作鋪。又【大雅】淮夷來鋪。【傳】鋪，病也。　又徧也。【詩·小雅】淪胥以鋪。【箋】鋪，徧也。【釋文】鋪，普烏反。王云：病也。　又【正字通】古器曰鋪，豆屬，有鋪?薦獻之義。博古圖：周劉公鋪，高五寸五分，深一寸六分，口徑七寸六分，容二升三合。銘云：劉公作杜嬬尊鋪，永寶用。名雖爲鋪，其器則豆也。　又【廣韻】【集韻】【正韻】?芳無切，音敷。【集韻】?也，設也。○按詩小雅、大雅、禮樂記、釋文?兼?、敷二音。　又【揚子

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［pū］
["Guangyun" Puhuqie, flat model, peng. ]
["Guangyun" Fang Wuqie, Pingyu, Fu. ]
Also known as "Shop 1". Traditional characters for "铺1".
(1) A kind of bronze ware. Legumes.
(2) Display; layout.
(3) Expand; flatten.
(4) Draping; covering.
(5) Shop narration.
(6) Cloth; publicity.
(7) 潽, overflow.
(8) Quantifiers. It is mostly used to indicate the amount of objects with a larger area or volume.
(9) Shop the first. The beast face of the title ring attached to the door.
(10) Onomatopoeia.
(11) Through "痡". Suffering.
(12) Through "镈". Farm tools for hoeing the fields and grass.
(13) Through "餔". See "spread food".
[②]［pù］
["Guang Yun" cut all the way, go to the evening, punishing. ]
Also known as "Shop 2". Traditional characters for "铺2".
(1) Bedding; bed.
(2) Store.
(3) Post station.
